intro: Minuartia leiosperma, commonly known as the smooth sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and small, fleshy leaves that are usually covered in a layer of fine, white hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Minuartia leiosperma is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
